intro: Commicarpus pentandrus, commonly known as the five-stamen spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are typically surrounded by specialized bracts. It is native to regions of southern Africa and thrives in dry, sandy soils. Commicarpus pentandrus is known for its ability to tolerate arid conditions and is often found in rocky or coastal environments.
